page.title: 18The Church.
page.content: The parish church of St.James stands on high ground,a little way out of the village to the north,but near the middle of the parish. The church,of architectural interest,is built of local sandstone rubble.The chancel dates from the first half of the twelth century,as does the base of the nave walls.The nave was rebuilt in the second half of thirteenth century in early English style,at the same time as the south chapel and the solid west tower.This is capped by an 80 ft wood shingled broach spire,which is a considerable local landmark. The tower contains six bells,the oldest of which is pre_Reformation, and still calls the parishioners to church every Sunday as it has done for the last five hundred years.
